data.text: @MaryLaGuerita @WesElyMD @EIonaSt @glynmoody Your best bet would be to see a neuropsychologist - ideally one who specializes in treating patients with brain injury.
@roxy_mojo @Cherdogmama @WesElyMD @CIBScenter :( that's terrible. People don't realize how debilitating it is because it didn't happen to them. What's yours like?

@constantaspara1 I'm not sure where I haven't addressed your concerns. Low processing speed is very common with autism, it's not totally unrelated. I'm not saying anything bad about autism. I'm sorry you took offense to what was supposed to be an empathetic remark, not my intention.
@WesElyMD Thank you so much for this.

@WesElyMD @forsaken911 You are welcome. I had read somewhere that a woman went into psychosis after Covid, and it made me wonder if my sudden issue was from vaccine. ‘Twas VERY strange! Perfectly fine again, except for lifelong Complex PTSD.
@WesElyMD And let’s not leave behind those with #MECFS who suffer similar issues

@Jellyjamjelly @WesElyMD I understand that your son experiences difficulties related to his processing speed and that you don’t want others to have the same struggles. Are my tweets clear? If not, please let me know so I can clarify. You haven’t addressed my concerns yet.
@constantaspara1 @WesElyMD This was the particular piece I was referencing. "How frustrating would it be in daily life to think that slowly".  Because he lives with it daily. https://t.co/n6XnLQu6vB

@Jellyjamjelly @WesElyMD I appreciate your concern, and like I said, it’s clear that you have good intentions. I can see that you’re concerned about what the future holds for long haulers and I thank you for it.

@Jellyjamjelly @WesElyMD And my point was that your son’s processing speed is not from his autism because the two are unrelated (unless he’s in sensory overload). There was no reason to mention autism at all. When others repeatedly hear that we’re slow, it hurts our employability and worsens the stigma.
